abstract_summ: The ongoing pandemic due to severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus type 2 (SARS‐CoV‐2) has led to unprecedented challenges for the global healthcare system . Severe disease is characterized by exuberant inflammation resulting from high circulating cytokines such as interleukin‐6 (IL‐6) and tumor necrosis factor (TNF) These inflammatory mediators are responsible for the detrimental effects on the immune, hematologic, respiratory, renal, gastrointestinal and other body systems .
